oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Postcard entitled "THE GLORY OF A LION IS HIS MANE"
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Illustrated British postcard that depicts a lion with a large mane. In his mane the artist has worked the names of the countries within the British Empire. From top to bottom they read: Canada, India, Australia, New Zealand, African Colonies. The reverse of the postcard reads, "THE MANE IS NOT MERELY A GLORIOUS ORNAMENT BUT A REAL PROTECTION TO A LION" and "A TRIBUTE TO THE COLONIES by William Armitage."
